citation: Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 12(1) of the Nature Conservation Act 2002 â€“

        (a) declare the private land specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of private nature reserve; and
        (b) give the name Sympathy Hills Private Nature Reserve to that reserved land; and
        (c) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which it is registered in accordance with section 22 of that Act.
16 June 2003

W. J. E. Cox

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

Bryan Green

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

SCHEDULE 1 - Sympathy Hills Private Nature Reserve

All that area of land comprising about 40.35 hectares as shown bounded by a heavy black line on Plan 5577 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 25 June 2003

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Water and Environment.
